task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 147°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent (base to roof) of the main building at 147° to estimate its height, so I should tilt up while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointing north instead of toward the target at ~147°SE, so I should rotate the yaw to face 147° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate height I need a view including the roof and upper facade of the main building at 147°, so I should tilt upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading has reset to 0° again, so I must rotate back to 147°SE while keeping pitch at 30° to view the building’s top for height estimation.
Since my pitch keeps returning to 0°, I should move closer to better gauge floors and architectural scale of the main building straight ahead at 147°.
I’m now facing 221°SW, so I need to rotate left to re-acquire the target building direction around 147°SE before estimating its height.
I overshot and am now facing 286°W, so I should rotate left to 147°SE to put the target building back in front of me.
From 221° I can directly rotate left to about 147° (a 74° yaw) to face the target building SE and proceed with height estimation.
Rotations are not landing as expected, so I'll use the provided absolute look option to set heading directly to 147° to face the target building.
To face 147°SE from 221°SW, I should rotate left by 74° so the target building is centered for height estimation.
Since rotating keeps bouncing between 221° and 286°, I'll move along the available path to a new node to regain a stable viewpoint on the SE-facing building.
The target is at ~147°, so from 221° I should rotate left about 74° to bring the SE building into view for height estimation.
I need to stop trying the same failing rotation loop and instead rotate using the back reference: turning to heading 106° (look back) is closer to 147° and can be fine-tuned next.
From 180°S I just need a small yaw left (eastward) to reach ~147°SE and center the target building.
The interface shows a direct option to look back to heading 147°, which is exactly the target direction for the building.
Rotating is not landing on 147° reliably, but the target building is likely visible from here; I should look up to capture the roofline and estimate height by story count.
Heading reset to 0° again, so I must yaw to 147° while keeping pitch up to view the building’s top and estimate its height.
Now that I'm correctly facing 147°, I should tilt up to include the roofline so I can estimate height from visible stories and typical floor-to-floor height.
The system keeps snapping to 0° when pitching up, so I should instead stay at pitch 0°, make the height estimate from the façade/story count visible at 147°, and finish.
